content.question: Student Test 1 Test 2 <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math> <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> <math alttext="7" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn></math> <math alttext="7" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn></math> <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math> <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn></math> <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn></math> <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math> <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn></math> <math alttext="9" overflow="scroll"><mn>9</mn></math> <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math> <math alttext="9" overflow="scroll"><mn>9</mn></math> <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn></math> <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn></math> <math alttext="9" overflow="scroll"><mn>9</mn></math> MEAN <math alttext="5.2" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.2</mn></math> <math alttext="6.5" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.5</mn></math> A group of ten students took a procedural memory test on Monday (Test 1), and then the same group of students took the same test again on Friday (Test 2). The scores on the two tests are given in the table. Which of the following is a correlation coefficient that was most likely obtained using the two sets of scores?

skill.text: 3.C: Interpret quantitative or qualitative inferential data from a given table, graph, chart, figure, or diagram.
